intro: Eschscholzia jonesii, commonly known as Jones' poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies. The plant produces showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Eschscholzia jonesii is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
